%%sql
CREATE TABLE 
    PipelineCheckpoints (
    PipelineName VARCHAR(8000),
    ActivityName VARCHAR(8000),
    Status VARCHAR(8000),
    LastUpdated timestamp
);

import logging
import pyodbc
import azure.functions as func
from datetime import datetime

def main(req: func.HttpRequest) -> func.HttpResponse:
    pipeline_name = req.params.get('pipelineName')
    activity_name = req.params.get('activityName')
    status = req.params.get('status')
    if not pipeline_name or not activity_name or not status:
        return func.HttpResponse(
            "Please pass pipelineName, activityName, and status on the query string or in the request body",
            status_code=400
        )

    conn = pyodbc.connect("Driver={ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server};Server=tcp:<your-server-name>.database.windows.net,1433;Database=<your-database-name>;Uid=<your-username>;Pwd=<your-password>;Encrypt=yes;TrustServerCertificate=no;Connection Timeout=30;")
    cursor = conn.cursor()
    cursor.execute("MERGE INTO PipelineCheckpoints AS target USING (SELECT ? AS PipelineName, ? AS ActivityName, ? AS Status, ? AS LastUpdated) AS source ON (target.PipelineName = source.PipelineName AND target.ActivityName = source.ActivityName) WHEN MATCHED THEN UPDATE SET Status = source.Status, LastUpdated = source.LastUpdated WHEN NOT MATCHED THEN INSERT (PipelineName, ActivityName, Status, LastUpdated) VALUES (source.PipelineName, source.ActivityName, source.Status, source.LastUpdated);", (pipeline_name, activity_name, status, datetime.utcnow()))
    conn.commit()
    cursor.close()
    conn.close()
    return func.HttpResponse(f"Checkpoint for {pipeline_name}-{activity_name} saved with status {status}.")
